ja5:1.1: From [sn3.13:6.1]() we can see that a _nāḷikā_ (“cup”, literally “tube”) of rice was sufficient for a modest serving.
ja5:1.2: The first two lines are spoken by horse traders, who have been told by the foolish valuer that their 500 horses are worth only a cup of rice. They ask the king what then is the value of a cup of rice.
